124 Poromac RivEr BRIDGE

possible use of determinate continuous truss spans of a patented type, in-
stead of Type “C”’ cantilever truss spans estimated herein. The arrange-
ment of the spans, in case such continuous truss type is used, will be similar
to that shown on alternate Plate 63A in Volume II, “Plates.”

The question of the use of this alternate truss type will be taken up with
the Commission, and, if so authorized, J. E. Greiner Company will submit
a supplemental report to cover the results of further investigations.

On October 13, 1938 J. E. Greiner Company prepared a certificate for use
by the Commission in dealing with the P. W. A., based on a layout similar
to that shown on Plate 63A, in which the total estimated cost of the bridge
and Maryland approach, exclusive of interest during construction and bond
discount was stated to amount to $4,112,000.
